JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. 
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways.  Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
The Enterprise Digital Member Experiences team (EDME) is responsible for the product management and design of American Express’ proprietary digital products – Amex Mobile App, americanexpress.com, Amex Offers, Customer Personalization and Amex communication channels (email, SMS & push notifications). 
As a team we are focused on driving engagement, satisfaction and revenue through a combination of best-in-class user experience and compelling features and functionality. We have a global remit and, with our partners across the company, we bring the best of American Express’ payment and related services to life through our digital experiences.
The Membership Web Product Operations team supports the Membership Web channel (MYCA, Loyalty & Guest Experiences) by connecting teams and processes that enable and optimize the delivery of essential digital experiences.  This team works closely with our product, design and engineering teams to increase transparency, drive efficiency in product development and speed to market of product delivery. 
We are looking for a Manager/Sr. Manager, Product Operations that will lead channel activities for the team.  The successful candidate will be a highly motivated self-starter who is able to provide strategic thought leadership and lead projects with limited guidance. The individual must be organized and a strong communicator who can effectively multitask and prioritize as needs evolve. 
 
Responsibilities:

Develop and optimize internal product development procedures for the Membership Web channel to improve effectiveness and ability to execute
Manage Membership Web channel full-stack Program Increment planning across Product, Engineering, Technology, Design & Research teams (includes leading key ceremonies such as mid-Program Increment communications and updates, channel prioritization, and full-stack channel readout) to produce a clear and unified delivery plan
Analyze Program Increment plan results to formulate recommendations and suggested changes to improve outcomes
Manage the relationship with stakeholders from across the enterprise through proactive communication 
Enforce product governance process across product teams to ensure adherence to American Express digital regulatory standards
Lead Process Risk Self-Assessment testing process and relevant refresh activities on a quarterly basis
Project manage cross-domain projects and initiatives on behalf of product teams and ensure timely execution   
Support issue resolution and audit requests in partnership with Ops Excellence and Compliance teams
Partner with internal program teams such as Lean Portfolio Management, Global Business Integration, Governance, etc. and serve as a single point of contact for business partners coordinating across product teams
Monitor and communicate progress of ongoing releases in terms of priorities, schedule and assessment of risks/issues. 


Bachelor’s Degree in related field required
Able to influence decisions across multiple stakeholders, in order to maintain integrity of channel plans and roadmap priorities
Facilitate meetings with internal and external stakeholders, with audiences reaching up to 100+ participants
Strong written and verbal communication skills, being able to communicate at a detailed or summary level depending on target audience
Manage several discrete streams of work simultaneously and take direction from multiple leadership areas, particularly as priorities are rapidly changing
Experienced with agile product development methodologies and tools (JIRA, Rally, Lean Portfolio Management, etc.)
Result focused & resourceful – with an appreciation of how to build products 
Pro-active and enthusiastic - able to take initiative and work within ambiguous situations.
Strategic thinking – Ability to see both the big picture and the details and to translate business requirements into actionable features and delivery plan.
4-6 years of experience in program and process management 
Impeccable communication skills, both on and offline
Previous product management experience a plus

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. 
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
